title: The Pacifista Are Full Genetic Clones, Not Just Robots
theoryText: When the Pacifista first appeared in episode 399, many fans theorized that these weren't just robots designed to look like Kuma, but actual genetic clones of Bartholomew Kuma that were then cybernetically enhanced. This theory suggested that cloning would be more efficient and align with Vegapunk's 'Human Weapon Project' terminology. The theory was later confirmed in the manga when it was revealed that Pacifistas are indeed clones of Kuma enhanced with cybernetics.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory was confirmed in much later episodes revealing Pacifista origins

title: The Three Captains Will Mirror the Roger Era's Great Pirates
theoryText: Following episode 399's promise between Luffy, Law, and Kid to meet in the New World, fans theorized that these three captains would recreate the structure of the previous generation's great pirates: Gol D. Roger, Edward Newgate (Whitebeard), and Golden Lion Shiki. The theory suggests Luffy parallels Roger (the Pirate King), Law parallels Whitebeard (protective and crew-focused), and Kid parallels Shiki (ambitious and ruthless). The three would divide the New World similar to how the previous generation did.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory involves their future accomplishments in Wano and beyond

title: Jean Bart Will Become a Key Heart Pirates Member
theoryText: After Jean Bart's dramatic recruitment in episode 399, fans theorized that as a former pirate captain himself, Jean Bart would become one of Law's most important crew members and potentially serve as a powerhouse fighter for the Heart Pirates. His past experience and immense strength would make him a valuable asset in future conflicts.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Speculation about Jean Bart's future role

title: Rayleigh's Revelations Will Lead to Revolutionary Truths About the Void Century
theoryText: When Rayleigh began revealing the truth about Roger in episode 399, fans theorized that his knowledge as Roger's first mate would eventually lead to major revelations about the Void Century, the true history of the world, and the secrets of the One Piece. Since Roger's crew learned the true history at Laugh Tale, Rayleigh possesses this knowledge and might share it with Luffy when the time is right.
author: One Piece Theory Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory involves endgame revelations about world history
